intro: Smilax stans, commonly known as the arrowhead vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial vine that typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and swamps. The plant has distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into red berries. Smilax stans is known for its woody stems and ability to climb or trail along the ground. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature.
